doc.previous: At the same time Marx stressed that capitalism was unstable and prone to periodic crises 93 He suggested that over time capitalists would invest more and more in new technologies and less and less in labour 79 Since Marx believed that surplus value appropriated from labour is the source of profits he concluded that the rate of profit would fall even as the economy grew 171 Marx believed that increasingly severe crises would punctuate this cycle of growth collapse and more growth 171 Moreover he believed that in the long term this process would necessarily enrich and empower the capitalist class and impoverish the proletariat 171 197 In section one of The Communist Manifesto Marx describes feudalism capitalism and the role internal social contradictions play in the historical process
doc.after: Marx believed that those structural contradictions within capitalism necessitate its end giving way to socialism or a post capitalistic communist society
